lexUnit.name: critical.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having a decisive importance in the success or failure of something.

sentence.text: Attitudes , of individuals , families , friends , whole societies , are absolutely critical to the maintenance of mental health and the relief of distress .
Therefore , it is absolutely critical that open market systems are developed , subsidy is abolished and there is a proper market economy in all parts of southern Africa .
The nature of letter writing has been emphasised , because it is critical to the success of a recruitment system .
Whether this is the case or not , it is critical to obtain copy planning permissions from the seller 's solicitors prior to exchange of contracts .
Emerson and Jackie swopped positions at Brands Hatch , with both of them missing gears at critical points and having to drive some time in oil thrown up by Ickx 's Ferrari .
The critical moment for harvest varies from year to year and from one plant to the next .
News of its loss disjointed German overall plans on the Left Bank at a most critical moment .
The cost of online services is not considered to be a critical factor in their use .
Notwithstanding the spread size , the critical factor for any borrower is fluctuations in LIBOR which determines most of a loan 's interest cost .
The critical factors in determining the growth in the present study are all external ; none are intrinsic to the science itself .
Confidence has been the critical factor in England 's success these past two years .
How you make that decision is critical to your survival and success as a student .
` What happens in the next few days is critical to our success .
` A critical success factor was the establishment of a close relationship with Geco-Prakla , " he says .
They are becoming increasingly critical to aircraft maintenance operations due to the shortfalls in trained and skilled staff experienced by the aviation world .
Critical to the power which trade unions exercise in our society is their standing at law .

Because the paper is so critical to the final outcome of the painting , watercolourists generally prefer high quality papers that will not yellow over time and minimise the original brilliance of the washes .
In frontier areas they are critical to our ability to win access .
The foregoing distinction is critical to the employee 's prospects of gaining an award .
The first 24 hours are the most critical .
